translated: Dindamahinna means “O, beat the drum of universal proclamation.”🔽Moreover, kollari means that the right side of one’s own head, the kalā, the sun, the unvanquished, the mouth below, the stream of vajra speech, and the form of the blazing lotus of method, in the location of the rasanā, are called bola.

original: mummu ni lte ba ste de las gzhan pa g-yon pa dang / a'a li dang zla ba dang / spro ba dang sdud pa byed pa can dang / thig le dang / sku'i rdo rje ma dang / steng gi kha dang rdo rje khu bar byed pa po'i rang bzhin gyis brkyang ma gnas pa ni kakko la zhes brjod do //

translated: Mūmūṇi means the navel. The other, the left, the āli, the moon, the one who causes emanation and reabsorption, the bindu, the vajra body, the mouth above, and the nature of the one who causes the vajra semen, in the location of the lalanā, are called kakkola.

original: de dag gi tha snyad gcig tu 'gyur bar byed pa sems kyi rdo rje'i tshul gyis kun 'dar ma ni lag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi tha snyad gcig tu 'gyur bar byed pa sems kyi rdo rje'i tshul gyis kun 'dar ma ni lag pa'o //
translated: The method of the vajra mind, which makes them one term, is that the avadhūtī is the hand.🔽Of that, whatever is the thumb and whatever is the ring finger, those are the rasanā and lalanā,🔽and the increase and decrease, the method and Nairātmyā yoginīs, and the waves of the conventional and the ultimate, are the squeezing.

original: de'i yang gang zhig mthe bo dang gang zhig srin lag de dag dang / ro ma brkyang ma dag dang / 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / thabs dang bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor ma dag dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rlabs dag gis btsir ba zhes bya ba ni btsir ba dang 'o dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa sbyor ba ro mnyam par byed pa longs spyod pa la rlabs gnyis ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yang gang zhig mthe bo dang gang zhig srin lag de dag dang / ro ma brkyang ma dag dang / 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / thabs dang bdag med ma'i rnal 'byor ma dag dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rlabs dag gis btsir ba zhes bya ba ni btsir ba dang 'o dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa sbyor ba ro mnyam par byed pa longs spyod pa la rlabs gnyis ni bza' ba'o //
translated: The squeezing, kissing, embracing, and so on, are the waves of the enjoyment of the yogic practice of the equal taste of the enjoyments.

original: 'di longs spyod rdzogs par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di longs spyod rdzogs par bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the enjoyment body.

original: de nas ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Then the gnosis will arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog gi gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog gi gnas so //
translated: This is the supreme stage.

original: gzhon nu'i dga' ba ji lta ba'am //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i dga' ba ji lta ba'am //
translated: Just like the joy of a youth,

original: dus gnyis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gnyis spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: abandoning the two times.

original: yang na bo la'i kolla ai re nor bur gnas pa ni bo la ste ro ma dang gsang ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na bo la'i kolla ai re nor bur gnas pa ni bo la ste ro ma dang gsang ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Or else, the bola-kolai-re, which is located in the jewel, is the bola, which is the rasanā and the secret vajra.

original: kakko l'a'i mummu ni lte bar gnas pa @302b kakko l'a dang brkyang ma gsang ba'i padma'o //
analyzed: kakko l'a'i mummu ni lte bar gnas pa @302b kakko l'a dang brkyang ma gsang ba'i padma'o //
translated: The kakkola-mummuni, which is located in the navel, is the kakkola and the lalanā, which is the secret lotus.

original: de dag nyid bo la ko l'a ai re /
analyzed: de dag nyid bo la ko l'a ai re /
translated: Those two are the bola-kolai-re.

original: kakko l'a mummu ni zhes bya ba yang de dag nyid ro mnyam par 'gyur ba yang kun 'dar mar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: kakko l'a mummu ni zhes bya ba yang de dag nyid ro mnyam par 'gyur ba yang kun 'dar mar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The kakkola-mummuni is also the same as those two, which become of equal taste, and also become the avadhūti.

original: bo l'a ko l'a ai rem kakko la mummu ni mar la mar ji lta ba'o //
analyzed: bo l'a ko l'a ai rem kakko la mummu ni mar la mar ji lta ba'o //
translated: The bola-kolai-re and the kakkola-mummuni are like ghee from milk.🔽Also, that avadhūti, which has the nature of the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya, is the destruction and the going of the limit of the separation of joy.

original: gang yang kun 'dar mar longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku can ma de yang bcom pa dang / phyin pa gang gis dga' bral gyi mtha' des dga' bral gyi dang po des bdag med pa de yang phyag rgya chen por nges te /
analyzed: gang yang kun 'dar mar longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku can ma de yang bcom pa dang / phyin pa gang gis dga' bral gyi mtha' des dga' bral gyi dang po des bdag med pa de yang phyag rgya chen por nges te /
translated: By that, the first separation of joy is the selflessness that is ascertained as the great seal.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i bo l'a ko ai re kakko l'a mummu ni zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i bo l'a ko ai re kakko l'a mummu ni zhes zer ro //
translated: The bola-kolai-re and the kakkola-mummuni are the great seal.

original: rang bzhin gyi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “natural method and wisdom” is that the nature of the deity is the method and the nature of the mantra is wisdom.

original: de dang lhan cig rtag tu kun du de'i rang bzhin yang dang yang du bsams nas /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig rtag tu kun du de'i rang bzhin yang dang yang du bsams nas /
translated: One should always contemplate the nature of the deity and the mantra together, again and again.

original: gang gis 'di myur du nges par 'gyur ba dang / rgyal ba'i tshogs kyi gtso bor 'gyur ba dang / rang rig par bya ba dang / rang rig pa po dang / rang rig pa ngag gi lam gyi spyod yul las 'das pa de'i rang bzhin gyis ye shes kyi kun gyi de kho na shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'di myur du nges par 'gyur ba dang / rgyal ba'i tshogs kyi gtso bor 'gyur ba dang / rang rig par bya ba dang / rang rig pa po dang / rang rig pa ngag gi lam gyi spyod yul las 'das pa de'i rang bzhin gyis ye shes kyi kun gyi de kho na shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one will quickly attain certainty, become the foremost in the assembly of victors, and understand the nature of the wisdom that is to be known, the knower, and the object of knowledge, which transcends the domain of verbal expression.

original: yang na kakko l'a mummu ni lte bar gnas pa dang / bo l'a ko l'a ai re nor bu'i rtse mor 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa rnam par spangs pa byang chub kyi sems bde ba chen po zla ba dang nyi ma dang bral ba bdag med pa rdo rje'i gnas mchog mtshungs pa med pa bde ba'i dga' ba med pa ni kakko la mummu ni bo l'a ai rem /
analyzed: yang na kakko l'a mummu ni lte bar gnas pa dang / bo l'a ko l'a ai re nor bu'i rtse mor 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags med pa rnam par spangs pa byang chub kyi sems bde ba chen po zla ba dang nyi ma dang bral ba bdag med pa rdo rje'i gnas mchog mtshungs pa med pa bde ba'i dga' ba med pa ni kakko la mummu ni bo l'a ai rem /
translated: The great bliss of bodhicitta, free from attachment and nonattachment, is the incomparable supreme place of the vajra, the bliss of non-joy, the kakkola mummuni bola ire.

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral bar ro mnyam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral bar ro mnyam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes the equal taste of attachment and nonattachment.

original: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa /

original: gang phyir thabs ni 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir thabs ni 'gyur ba nyid //

translated: fear is the end of existence through wisdom.

original: des na rab 'jigs yod ma yin //
analyzed: des na rab 'jigs yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, there is no great fear,

original: de nyid la ni chags pa med //
analyzed: de nyid la ni chags pa med //

original: la la 'jig pas 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: la la 'jig pas 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: Some are destroyed by destruction,

original: 'jig pa'i dngos med zad med ce'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dngos med zad med ce'o //

original: 'di dag thams cad med pas de med par 'gyur ba dang / de med pas thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad med pas de med par 'gyur ba dang / de med pas thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of these are nonexistent, and so that [primal substance] is nonexistent. And because that [primal substance] is nonexistent, all of these are nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du yang ji ltar gtso bo de ni ji ltar sems kyi rdo rje phyi rol du gyur pa dbang po'i don gyi rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang bas sems nyid kyi phyi rol du snang @303a * //

translated: In the same way, just as the primal substance is the mind’s vajra, so the external objects of the senses, such as form, appear individually due to the mind’s own appearance as external.

original: ba'o ; / ji ltar /
analyzed: ba'o ; / ji ltar /
translated: As it is said:

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //🔽rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas // rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //

original: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa po //

original: lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lus gnas lus las ma skyes pa'o //
translated: It abides in the body, but is not born from the body.🔽As it is said:

original: ji ltar / sems spangs nas ni lus kyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar / sems spangs nas ni lus kyis ni //

original: sems ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: sems ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid //

original: sangs rgyas gzhan du bstan du med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan du bstan du med //
translated: Buddhahood is not taught as something else.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di re zhig nges so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di re zhig nges so //
translated: Thus, this is certain for the moment.

original: de yang dbye ba tsam ste /
analyzed: de yang dbye ba tsam ste /

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi sras po rnams 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad phye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi sras po rnams 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad phye ba ste /
translated: Thus, everything is divided in order for the sons of the Buddha to enter.

original: don dam pa la 'byed pa po dang / dbye ba dang / dbye bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa la 'byed pa po dang / dbye ba dang / dbye bar bya ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate, there is no division, no division, and no division itself.

analyzed: ji ltar na sgom pa po dang ; bsgom pa dang / bsgom par bya ba de nyid du yang bstan to //

analyzed: gang byang chub kyi sems chen po de nyid la grol ba rnams dang / gnas rnams 'byung ba dang / de nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams so //
translated: The great mind of enlightenment itself is the source of those who are liberated, those who abide, and those who attain complete nirvana.

analyzed: de'i phyir dang po'i sangs rgyas mchog tu bde ba nges pa kho na dang / rang rang rig pas rang rig pa dang / rang rig par bya bas /
translated: Therefore, the first buddha is the supreme bliss, the ascertainment itself, the self-awareness by self-awareness, and the object of self-awareness.

translated: One should know the vajra of one’s own nature, which is the nature of that [vajra], and the abode of that [vajra], which is the abode of the great seal, oneself.

translated: One should know the vajra of one’s own nature, which is the nature of that [vajra], and the abode of that

original: 'dis @303b ci bstan ce na /
